holidays.name: World Bicycle Day
holidays.description: A day to recognize the uniqueness, longevity, and versatility of the bicycle, and to promote cycling for health and environmental benefits.
holidays.origin: Declared by the United Nations in 2018 to promote safe, accessible, and sustainable cycling worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Did you know the first bicycle is over 200 years old and was called the 'Draisine' or 'running machine'?

holidays.name: Egg Drop Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the physics and comedy of egg dropping! People participate in contests of dropping raw eggs from heights with homemade protectors to keep them unbroken.
holidays.origin: Often celebrated in schools and science clubs to teach basic principles of gravity and engineering.
holidays.funFact: The largest egg drop competition had over 1,000 participants trying to save their eggs from cracking.

holidays.name: Drive-In Movie Day

holidays.origin: Commemorates the height of drive-in movie popularity in the mid-20th century, reminding us to enjoy classic cinema in a fun setting.
holidays.funFact: The first-ever drive-in movie theater opened in New Jersey in 1933.
